alert.note: Alert for Wabasha (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 05 at 9:24AM CST until March 06 at 11:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Slushy Snow Moves In Tonight... .Wet, slushy snow will develop this evening with the highest impact period expected from this evening into early Monday morning. Snowfall rates in excess of an inch an hour will be possible for a few hours resulting in quick accumulations on roads and slick, difficult travel. Light mixed precipitation could persist into Monday along with gusty winds. Although most of the accumulation snow will be done by sunrise, some travel impacts for the Monday morning commute are possible. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM CST MONDAY... * WHAT...Wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. * WHERE...In Minnesota, Wabasha County. In Wisconsin, Buffalo, Trempealeau and Jackson Counties. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 11 AM CST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. In Minnesota, visit 511mn.org for road conditions. In Wisconsin, visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
